page.title: 05INSECTICIDES AND ECOLOGY
page.content: {A SPECIFIC FARM.} During the past few years trees have been planted both evergreen and deciduous in small corners of fields and where older trees have fallen or died. The greatest asset on the farm is the hedgegrowth we have managed to re- establish. These hedges are of the box shape and about 2.2 metres high and 1.5 metres wide with grass banks which give ample scope for smaller animals and insects. Old watering holes have been kept and bushes and trees planted, where possible - such as willows. Chemical spraying is kept to a minimum and none whatsoever used on the headlands of the fields so as to give an even larger area for insects, small birds and animals to live and compete with each other in their own environment.
